Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
I'd like to restate my recommendation that Komodo add a legal/compliance page to the website, as well as Antara Composer.

This should include access to the legal documentation stating KMD is not a security (Howey Test), and also an explanation (preferably by legal professional), as well as linking Money Transmitter regulations, stating that AtomicDEX does not fall into Money Transmitter category.

These are important for comforting investors of KMD to make sure they can stay compliant if need be, as well as opening up KMD to others. It also gives gives businesses or other projects comfort to build on Atomicdex.


Based on the information here. 
https://discordapp.com/channels/412898016371015680/521735824300310539/622466433972043806

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Adding your request to our website changes board @Regnar ...In the past, we've only shared the Howey memo privately to firms/orgs asking for it. We've already planned on adding legal language in the next major atomicDEX website refresh, but we'll also discuss internally on if this should be added to our main page as well.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I would assume most people who visit the site won't bother browsing the legal section, but those who are looking for it will appreciate it. The reality is Komodo is one of thousands of crypto projects and having information easily available that a company/business/project would ask for saves them the effort of having to reach out to ask for something that might not even exist.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: A business browsing hundreds of crypto project websites isn't going to reach out to each of them and ask for something most of them won't even have. This may be more in line with giving them something they didn't know they wanted

Author: Matthias#2174
Content: Read an interesting article about the scalability issue of public Blockchains, how Ethereum is becoming increasingly centralised as more and more nodes are unable to sync due to network demands, and why this will force Ethereum to increase blocksize cap which will raise fees and eventually prevent DApps from functioning. Was curious to understand if this is an issue that Komodo may face in the future and if so, how would one mitigate the risk? https://hackernoon.com/the-ethereum-blockchain-size-has-exceeded-1tb-and-yes-its-an-issue-2b650b5f4f62

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I believe the core concept of having a multi-chain ecosystem completely negates this from being a factor. Each chain has it's own blockchain and doesn't require the komodo chain to do anything.

Author: Matthias#2174
Content: Ok so nothing is built on the Komodo chain itself?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
@Matthias Whatever is built on Komodo main blockchain is adoptable by the Antara Smartchains.
If you for example start your own project using Komodo tech, instead of creating a token on top of KMD's main chain unlike Ethereum's ERC20 tokens, you are actually using the Komodo's daemon `komodod` to start your very own blockchain with few blockchain parameters including it's name, supply, consensus and many other configurable params, which gives you full control on it.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: to get started, I'd recommend to go through this link: https://developers.komodoplatform.com

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: https://developers.komodoplatform.com/basic-docs/smart-chains/introduction-to-smart-chain-documentation.html

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Since you have your own independent blockchain you don't even get scalability issue unless your own project hits it's peak block size limit

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: and even if you hit that, there is then scalability solution which lets you make a cluster of your very own project's blockchain.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: this cluster of your own blockchain gives your unlimited scalability option

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`Ok so nothing is built on the Komodo chain itself?`
I can imagine that someday there will be stuff other than notarizations, but as pointed out above there's no need to ever carry as much data as Ethereum does per block

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
I think it would be a good idea to have an ecosystem github list where people who are independently developing Komodo capabilities can voluntarily list their github repos. This could account for when people fork branches to work on them themselves before merging back, or those branches that don't ever get merged into Komodo but are still part of the development ecosystem. For example I have some Python repos for an nSPV wallet, some RPC wrappers, and TokensCC APIs and projects on my github which are Komodo specific but aren't considered in the development ecosystem by a lot of metrics.

Not sure what this "list" would look like structure wise

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: There was a komodo wiki on github that was like this but I'm having trouble finding it.
